content.description: Climb the dihedral using face and crack holds. At the top there are some blocks that look like they could be loose, just right of the 2-bolt anchor. As of 11/2020, they were solid.
content.location: Toward the right end of the crag before it curves around and away from the river, just left of an overhanging bulge, there is a left-facing dihedral with a crack in the corner.

content.description: Climb the gully/crack/chimney between the two pillars and make your ay toward the top of the right pillar, and then up and right on some flakes to the right of the 2-bolt anchor.
content.location: Locate the gully/crack between two pillar-type features, the one on the left being shorter.

content.description: From the top of the flat bench, scramble up 5-6ft of lower angle small ledgy climbing to an overhang. Make a cruxy move over the bulge and follow sandy pockets for 2-3 bolts to a ledge down and right of the two bolt anchor. Stand on the ledge and make a few more moves up to the right of the anchor.
content.location: There is a small sign at the bottom of the route with the route name on it, though as of 11/2020, the name is a bit difficult to read. On top of a flat bench, scramble up 5-6ft to an overhang.
